item.title: Amy add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I lean and loaf at my ease... observing a spear of summer grass." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I write this sitting in the kitchen sink." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Amy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Amy add a quote by ZORA NEALE HURSTON
item.description: "Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How <i>can</i> any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? Itâ€™s beyond me." -- ZORA NEALE HURSTON

item.title: Amy add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amy add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "In the haunted house of life, art is the only stair that doesn't creak." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amy add a quote by Twyla Tharp
item.description: "I read for growth, firmly believing that what you are today and what you will be in five years depends on two things: the people you meet and the books you read." -- Twyla Tharp

item.title: Amy add a quote by Tagore
item.description: "I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy." -- Tagore

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description:
"My religious convictions and scientific views cannot at present be more specifically defined than as those of a believer in creative evolution. I desire that no public monument or work of art or inscription or sermon or ritual service commemorating me shall suggest that I accepted the tenets peculiar to any established church or denomination nor take the form of a cross or any other instrument of torture or symbol of blood sacrifice.
[<i>From the will of GBS</i>]" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Amy add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Amy add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To you, I'm an atheist. To God, I'm the loyal opposition." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All thinking men are atheists." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Amy add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Amy add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Amy add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "belief is the death of intelligence." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ayaan Hirsi Ali
item.description: "The only position that leaves me with no cognitive dissonance is atheism. It is not a creed. Death is certain, replacing both the siren-song of Paradise and the dread of Hell. Life on this earth, with all its mystery and beauty and pain, is then to be lived far more intensely: we stumble and get up, we are sad, confident, insecure, feel loneliness and joy and love. There is nothing more; but I want nothing more." -- Ayaan Hirsi Ali

item.title: Amy add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Properly read, the Bible is the most potent force for atheism ever conceived." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The Bible has noble poetry in it... and some good morals and a wealth of obscenity, and upwards of a thousand lies." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amy add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "I would love to believe that when I die I will live again, that some thinking, feeling, remembering part of me will continue. But as much as I want to believe that, and despite the ancient and worldwide cultural traditions that assert an afterlife, I know of nothing to suggest that it is more than wishful thinking." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Green
Amy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I'm not saying that everything is survivable. Just that everything except the last thing is." -- John Green

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting." -- John Green

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Amy add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "Stories have a way of changing faces. They are unruly things, undisciplined, given to delinquency and the throwing of erasers. This is why we must close them up into thick, solid books, so they cannot get out and cause trouble." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kristin Cashore
item.description: "I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said. "It would look stunning, My Lady," she called. She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face." -- Kristin Cashore
